findings.title: Dead code: merge indicator loop was a no-op
findings.issue: The merge indicator loop iterated over all tasks but every code path was empty (only comments). Pure dead code bloating the function.
findings.impact: No runtime impact — purely dead code. Removed.

findings.title: No-op line: inEdges.get(d.from) without assignment
findings.issue: Line `inEdges.get(d.from)` called .get() without using the return value. Comment said 'ensure key exists' but Map.get() doesn't create keys. If a dependency referenced a task not in the task list, the outEdges/inEdges push would silently fail via optional chaining but not guard against it.
findings.suggestion: Added explicit guard: skip edges referencing tasks not in taskMap. Removed the no-op line.
findings.impact: Silent incorrect behavior if dependencies reference non-existent task IDs.

findings.title: Unused variable assignment: totalWidth reassigned but never read
findings.issue: After shrinking columns, totalWidth was reassigned but never used again. TypeScript compiler warning (6133).
findings.suggestion: Changed `let` to `const` and removed the reassignment inside the if block.
findings.impact: No runtime impact — compiler warning only. Fixed.

suppressedFindings.title: Cyclic dependency in renderDAG produces silent incorrect output
suppressedFindings.reason: While cycles cause tasks to default to depth 0 (producing visually wrong but non-crashing output), cyclic dependencies in task DAGs are inherently invalid input. The function is called with SpecWeave task data which is validated upstream. Adding cycle detection would add complexity for an input that should never occur. Noted for potential future hardening.
